moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6: Philidor's Defense -- not a good line for an amateur to try. Playable but requires exactness on the part of Black.
moves.3. d4 f5: Opens up the position too early. Black is cramped and behind in development. This will only help White.
moves.4. dxe5 fxe4 5. Ng5: This Knight will be hard to drive. Also, Black must be wary of White's threatened Q-R5ch.
moves.7. e6 Bxc3+: A poor move. Why exchange off your only active piece? 7...N-K2 or 7...N-KB3 would prepare for castling. N-KB3 would also prevent White from playing Q-R5ch.
moves.8. bxc3 Nh6: Incomprehensible. Why not move this Knight to KB3 instead? Now the master punishes Black's errors.
moves.9. Qh5+: 8...N-KB3 would have made this move impossible.
moves.9... Kf8 10. Ba3+: White is on a King-hunt. Mate follows quickly and inevitably.
moves.10... Kg8: Hopeless, but there are no good moves.
moves.11. Qf7+ Nxf7 12. exf7#: A splendid bit of attacking play.

opening: Philidor (C41), Philidor counter-gambit, del Rio attack
